intro: Uvifera lehmannii, commonly known as the Lehmann's uvilla, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shrublands and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
